title: Government will take legal action if rice not sold at controlled prices: President
byline: Claiming that the government had held discussions with rice millers on the prices of rice, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today that legal action will be taken against those who fail to sell rice at the controlled prices.

title: Bangladesh steps up repayments to Adani to avoid power supply cut
byline: Bangladesh is ramping up payments to Adani Power after the Indian conglomerate cut electricity supplies by half, reportedly over an unpaid $800m bill.

title: Ex-soldier arrested with stock of firearms
byline: A retired army soldier was arrested with an AK-47 rifle, several other firearms, and sharp weapons during a raid in Embilipitiya yesterday.

title: Journalists prevented from covering PM’s meeting with Mahanayaka
byline: Journalists who gathered to cover the meeting which Prime Minister Harini Amararasuriya had with the Mahanayaka of the Ramanya Chapter, Most Venerable Makulewe Wimala Thera in Kalutara were reportedly prevented from carrying out their duties.

title: Shakib Al Hasan reported for suspect bowling action
byline: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has been reported by the umpires due to a suspect bowling action during his one-off appearance for Surrey in this season’s County Championship.

title: ADB optimistic about reforms but warns of limited room to manoeuvre
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) said that it remains optimistic about the continuity of the reforms in Sri Lanka but warns that there is very little room to manoeuvre as the country seeks a sustainable recovery.

title: CBK raises concerns over assassination plot amid security cut
byline: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga raised alarm over a significant reduction in her security detail, warning of the potential for a targeted assassination, similar to the politically motivated killing of her husband, Vijaya Kumaratunga.

title: Dubai consulate extends amnesty period by two months
byline: The general amnesty period announced by the Dubai Consulate General, initially set to end on October 31, has been extended by two months, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) said.

title: Sri Lankan migrants stranded on Diego Garcia offered move to UK
byline: Migrants stranded for years on the remote Indian Ocean island of Diego Garcia will be offered the right to come to the UK, under a government proposal.

title: Ex-Minister Wijesekera denies CPSTL chairman’s claim on compensation agreement
byline: Former Lower and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera condemned a recent statement by Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminals Limited (CPSTL) Chairman D.J.A.S De S. Rajakaruna, clarifying that the previous government did not enter into any agreement with other operators to compensate them for losses incurred on sales or pricing.

title: SC orders continuation of trial against Pujith, Hemasiri over Easter Sunday attacks
byline: While setting aside the Colombo High Court Trial-at-Bar judgment which acquitted former IGP Pujith Jayasundara and former Defence Secretary Hemasiri Fernando of charges related to the Easter Sunday bomb attack case, the Supreme Court today ordered the Trial-at-Bar to proceed with the trial and to call upon the accused to present their defence

title: Nine reservoirs start spilling due to heavy rains
byline: A total of nine out of 73 major reservoirs have begun spilling due to heavy rains in the catchment areas, the Water Management Branch of the Irrigation Department reported.

title: When will we know who has won the US election?
byline: American voters go to the polls on 5 November to choose their next president.

title: Man arrested for circulating fake Rs. 5,000 note featuring President’s image
byline: A 38-year-old man was arrested for circulating an image of a fake Rs. 5,000 note, featuring a picture of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on social media.

title: Sri Lanka ranks 95 along with Iran and South Sudan in Passport Index
byline: Singapore has once again claimed the title of the world’s most powerful passport, according to the latest Henley Passport Index released in October 2024 by London-based global citizenship and residence advisory firm Henley & Partners.

title: Search of his residence: Sujeewa to file legal action
byline: While labelling the search of his residence as an act of political victimisation, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) National Organizer Sujeewa Senasinghe said today that he will file legal action against the Walana Corruption Prevention Unit.

title: Woman hacked to death at private hospital in Trincomalee
byline: The Trincomalee Police have launched an investigation after a woman was hacked to death inside a private hospital in Trincomalee early this morning.

title: Thai woman nabbed at BIA with ’ice’ worth Rs. 100 million
byline: A Thai woman arriving from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with 197 grams of ’ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) concealed in her luggage.

title: Landslide warning issued for eight districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) today (05) issued early landslide warnings for eight districts.

title: Appeal Court upholds four-year jail term for ex-deputy minister
byline: The Court of Appeal today upheld the four-year rigorous imprisonment sentence imposed by the Colombo High Court on former Deputy Minister Shantha Premaratne for soliciting and accepting a bribe in 2007.

title: Sri Lanka to experience heavy showers tonight, tomorrow
byline: The Department of Meteorology has predicted substantial rainfall for most parts of the island tonight.

title: Rural development, government’s primary objective this term: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that rural development and upgrading the rural people’s social and economic well-being is one of the primary objectives of the government during this term.

title: Chief Jailor, another official of New Magazine Prison interdicted
byline: The Chief Jailor and a Prison Guard (storekeeper) at the Colombo New Magazine Prison have been interdicted after they were found to have supplied mobile phones to inmates.

title: Polls open for 2024 US Election Day
byline: Polls have opened for the 2024 United States election, a national vote that will decide not only the next president of the country but also the makeup of the House of Representatives and the Senate.

title: Ill-fated KDU bus driven by driver with suspended license
byline: The driver of the bus that encountered a fatal accident in Badulla had driven the bus with a fake license after his license was suspended by the Galle Magistrate over an accident.
